results.title: peanut chutney , how to make peanut chutney | quick peanut chutney

steps.step: heat oil in a pan.fry the peanuts on a low to medium flame for 3-4 minutes.add the curry leaves and fry for a minute.lastly add the roasted chana dal, sesame seeds & asafoetida and fry for 2-3 minutes more on a low flame.take care that you don't over brown or burn this mixture, else the chutney might have bitter tones.let this mixture warm or cool down.add in a chutney grinder or a small blender.add in the ginger, green chilies and salt.pour some water and grind the peanut chutney to a smooth consistency.you can make the peanut chutney thick or of medium consistency.check the salt and add more if required.serve peanut chutney with idli, dosa, medu vada, uttapam or pakoras.

ingredients.name: chana dal
ingredients.original: ¼ cup roasted chana dal/bengal gram
ingredients.originalString: ¼ cup roasted chana dal/bengal gram

ingredients.name: green chili
ingredients.original: 1-2 green chili or dry red chilies
ingredients.originalString: 1-2 green chili or dry red chilies
ingredients.originalName: green chili or dry red chilies

ingredients.name: chana dal
ingredients.original: ¼ cup roasted chana dal/bengal gram

results.title: Roasted cabbage with a lime peanut sauce

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.Grease a baking sheet.In a small bowl whisk together sesame oil, mustard, lime juice, salt & pepper.
Place sliced cabbage in a large bowl, pour dressing over it and toss well.
Spread cabbage onto baking sheet and roast for about 60 minutes until crispy, tossing occasionally.Top with chopped peanuts and additional salt & pepper to taste.

ingredients.name: red cabbage
ingredients.original: 1 medium head of red cabbage, sliced
ingredients.originalString: 1 medium head of red cabbage, sliced

ingredients.name: red cabbage
ingredients.original: 1 medium head of red cabbage, sliced
ingredients.originalString: 1 medium head of red cabbage, sliced

steps.step: Place pork and water in a large skillet. Cook over medium-high heat, sirrring and breaking up pork with a spoon or spatula, until pork is cooked through.
Remove from heat and stir in lime juice, fish sauce, and red chile paste. Allow to cool in the skillet for about 5 minutes.
Add, onion, ginger, peanuts, and cilantro. Toss to combine.
Serve with cabbage wedges.

ingredients.name: ginger
ingredients.original: 2 tablespoons thinly sliced ginger matchstick slices
ingredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons thinly sliced ginger matchstick slices

ingredients.name: peanuts
ingredients.original: 2 tablespoons cocktail peanuts lightly salted recommended
ingredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons cocktail peanuts lightly salted recommended

steps.step: Preheat greased grill to medium-high heat.  Grill chicken 10 to 12 min. or until cooked through (165F), turning after 5 min. and brushing occasionally with 1/4 cup dressing.
Toss cabbage with carrots, peanuts and remaining dressing.
Serve with the chicken.
